name: isosorbide
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1398
Reason: 1,1,1,2,2-pentafluoroethane has a melting point of -97 degrees Celsius. The compound isosorbide has a melting point that is influenced by the functional groups in the molecule relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The presence of two phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The fluorine atoms increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the rigidity of the structure, estimated at around +10°C for each fluorine atom. The methyl group introduces a slight increase in molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5°C.
